            A little about myself
            I am an applied economist, with interests ranging from climate and environmental issues, to trade, innovation policies and macroeconomic forecasting.
            Born in Brazil, and grown up around the world, I have spent most of my life travelling. After completing a PhD in economics at Durham University, I went on working in the banking industry and for international organisations in Geneva.
            At the moment I work as a research economist at the World Trade Organization (WTO), where I am involved in several projects related to trade and the environment.

articles.contents:
Research interests & Ongoing projects
I am currently working on a number of research projects for the World Trade Organization (WTO). As a member of the Quantitative modelling and analysis unit, I deal with economic research and econometric modelling of trade, with a particular focus on the environment-related activities of WTO. My current research projects relate to regional trade agreements, environmental measures, fisheries subsidies, innovation and trade.
In addition to the above, I am also fascinated by recent development in AI. I am currently starting a series of papers in which I apply AI techniques to macroeconomic forecasting and issues in environmental economics.
